summary: Website project for collecting user-submitted data via forms (e.g., Residential Certificate application details collection), with requested branding updates (site name "MD SUHEL", blue background, and a selected logo in the header).
architectural_notes: Project scope shifted from fitness training website to a form-based data collection website for certificate/application details (e.g., Residential Certificate).
Branding requirement update: site title/name should be “MD SUHEL”, use a blue background, and include a header logo (user may not provide an asset; select a suitable image if needed).
imageRequirements:
## Required Images
- Minimal modern monogram logo with the letters "MS" in a blue-and-white palette, flat vector style, transparent background (md-suhel-logo.dim_256x256.png)

existing_features.title: Create a responsive marketing-style landing page for a fitness training website with clear navigation and sections for: Hero (value proposition + primary CTA), Featured Training Programs, How It Works, Testimonials, Pricing, and Footer.
Implement Internet Identity sign-in/sign-out in the UI and gate workout logging and progress pages behind authentication (unauthenticated users can still view marketing/Programs pages).
Add a Programs browsing experience: list training programs with program detail pages, including title, difficulty, duration, equipment, description, and a sample weekly schedule.
Add workout logging for authenticated users: allow selecting a date, selecting a program (optional), entering workout name, duration, notes, and saving the entry.
Add a Progress page for authenticated users that shows: weekly workout count, total minutes trained this week, and a simple history list filtered by date range.

Apply a cohesive visual theme appropriate for fitness training (distinct color palette, typography scale, and consistent component styling) and use it consistently across all pages and states (logged in/out, empty states, errors). Avoid blue/purple as primary brand colors.

Add generated static images to the app and use them in the UI: a hero banner image on the landing page and small program category icons on the Programs page. Store images under frontend/public/assets/generated and reference them directly from the frontend.

Add a new user flow for submitting a Residential Certificate application: a dedicated page with a multi-section form that collects applicant details and submits them to the backend, then shows a clear success confirmation with a generated application reference number.
Add a "My Applications" page that lets a user view their submitted applications and open an application detail view showing all stored fields and current status (e.g., "Submitted").

Create and apply a coherent, government-service-style visual theme (neutral, trustworthy palette; strong typographic hierarchy; clear form affordances) and use it consistently across the new application pages, including loading, empty, error, and success states.
Update the app branding to use the website name "MD SUHEL" in all existing global branding locations (header brand/title, footer copyright text, and the HTML document title).

Apply a blue background theme across the application so the overall page background is visibly blue while keeping text readable and maintaining consistent styling for cards, borders, and interactive elements.
Add a logo in the header using a generated static image selected by the system (since the user did not provide a logo), and display it next to the "MD SUHEL" site name.

new_feature_requests.summary: Create a website for fitness training use

Backend: implement Motoko data models and stable storage for (a) training programs (read-only for now) and (b) per-user workout logs keyed by authenticated principal; expose query/update methods needed by the frontend for listing programs, reading a program, creating a workout log, listing logs, and computing progress aggregates.
Build a form-based website to collect user details for applications (e.g., Residential Certificate), including data entry forms and submission flow.
Implement Motoko data models and stable storage for Residential Certificate applications, including create and read methods needed by the UI.
